Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

Every time firefox 4.1 is reloaded, the toolbar icons are larger than normal.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Restart Firefox
2. Toolbar icons are now bigger than normal


Actual Results:  
Icons in toolbar are larger than they should be.

Expected Results:  
Shown the icons at the normal size.

For some reason, this happened after removing the software that adds LastPass plugin to ever browser. Coincidentally, the lastpass icon is the normal size.

It's fixed when customizing the toolbar, checking Use Small Icons, then unchecking it.

Every time firefox 4.1 is reloaded, the toolbar icons are larger than normal.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Restart Firefox
2. Toolbar icons are now bigger than normal


Actual Results:  
Icons in toolbar are larger than they should be.

Expected Results:  
Shown the icons at the normal size.

For some reason, this happened after removing the software that adds LastPass plugin to ever browser. Coincidentally, the lastpass icon is the normal size.

It's fixed when customizing the toolbar, checking Use Small Icons, then unchecking it.

comments.author: tdowner@mozilla.com
liamnoone92@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
Sort of. There's a lastpass application (for windows, at least) that installs it's extension on all web browsers (that they have an extension for) automatically. When I removed this application, it also removed the LP extension from Firefox (and probably other browsers), and that's what started this. So maybe when an extension is forced (not removed by the normal means) from firefox, it causes this bug.

About the security-flag, that was accidentally added, I guess.
